Description: Rim sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; part of lotus-palmette and rosette in added white outline with added red centres; exterior, from top: band of diagonal dashes at rim; maeander band between lines; band of dots; sphinx (top of head and part of curlicue remaining) to left, with part of pendant lozenge and pendant rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The exterior and interior surfaces of the sherd were burned during the bombings in London in 1941.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1589) (phase 2)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: ucl np 57 (Other Accession Number)
